Key Match Events: Ragnar Oratmangoen equalized for Indonesia just before the end of the first half
Rafael Struick scored a stunning curling goal to give Indonesia a 2-1 lead in the 75th minute
Mohamed Mahroon scored again for Bahrain in the 98th minute to level the score at 2-2
Post-Match Reflections: The Indonesian national team lodged a strong protest, arguing that the referee's decision had put them at an unfair disadvantage
The public, especially Indonesian netizens, reacted strongly to the incident, with the hashtag #Wasit becoming a trending topic in Indonesia on the X platform
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Bahrain Football Association (BFA) has been severely sanctioned by FIFA with a fine of 10,000 Swiss francs for unsportsmanlike conduct of their supporters during the match against Japan
Others: The match between Indonesia and Bahrain was marred by controversy due to the referee's decision to allow play to continue after the allotted time had expired, resulting in six extra minutes being played
